title: Lazy decoding for submessage fields
description:
Support lazy decoding for submessage fields marked with [lazy = true]. This defers unmarshalling until first access, improving performance for large messages where not all fields are accessed.

The IsLazy() detection is already implemented but not used for actual deferred decoding.

See: https://protobuf.dev/reference/go/opaque-faq/#lazy-decoding

title: Closed enum validation
description:
Edition feature: features.enum_type controls enum behavior:
- OPEN (edition default) - allows unknown values in field
- CLOSED (proto2 default) - stores unknown values in unknown fields

Should validate and handle closed enums properly during unmarshal.

See: https://protobuf.dev/editions/features/

title: v0.6.0 is creating issues in ubuntu20
description:
Jenkins CI/CD pipeline (Ubuntu 20.0) breaks after upgrading to v0.6.0 with error:
protoc-gen-go-vtproto: program not found or is not executable

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/134
Author: scarshad

title: Opaque API: Lazy Decoding
description:
Match the upcoming/new API and support lazy decoding feature from: https://go.dev/blog/protobuf-opaque

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/150
Author: coxley

title: Request for Metrics on Object Pool Usage (Taken vs Returned)
description:
Expose metrics around object pool usage:
- Number of objects taken from the pool
- Number of objects returned to the pool
- Optionally grouped by object type

This would help identify memory leaks caused by objects taken from the pool not being returned properly.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/160
Author: ganeshk312

title: gRPC codec has different semantic on Unmarshal than the default one
description:
The custom gRPC codec performs a merge rather than an override on unmarshal. This can cause issues when using grpc streams where msg.ResetVT() is required to keep the same behavior as the default codec.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/128
Author: aureliar8

title: Pooled Objects - Recursive Pool Usage
description:
When unmarshalling an object from a pooled instance, the pooling support should be able to use pooled instances all the way down as it grabs and allocates objects. Even if I pool the outer object, only that level is being serviced from the pool. As it expands the children, these are always new allocations today.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/162
Author: steve-gray

title: UTF-8 string validation
description:
The proto3 specification requires UTF-8 validation for string fields. Currently vtprotobuf does not validate UTF-8 during marshal/unmarshal.

Edition feature: features.utf8_validation with options:
- VERIFY (proto3 default) - reject invalid UTF-8
- NONE (proto2 default) - allow any bytes

Should add validation based on the utf8_validation feature setting.

Related upstream issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/146

title: Buf Schema Registry
description:
Push protobuf files to the Buf Schema Registry to make it easier to use annotations for those who already use buf CLI tooling.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/157
Author: sudorandom

title: Invalid UTF-8 in strings are not rejected
description:
The proto2 and proto3 specifications state that the string type must be encoded as valid UTF-8, and the golang protobuf implementation rejects invalid utf8 string on marshaling and unmarshaling in proto3. vtprotobuf should support UTF-8 string validation for proto3 to ensure consistent behavior.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/146
Author: kirk91

title: ResetVT does not work with oneof fields
description:
When using pools with bytes inside a oneof field, the memory is no longer reused. The ResetVT method should handle oneof fields to preserve allocated byte slices.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/144
Author: codesoap

title: DELIMITED message encoding (groups replacement)
description:
Edition 2024 replaces proto2 group syntax with features.message_encoding = DELIMITED. This uses start/end group wire format.

Need to handle DELIMITED encoding in marshal/unmarshal code generation.

See: https://protobuf.dev/editions/features/

title: Hybrid API code generation support
description:
The Hybrid API (API_HYBRID) has both public fields and accessor methods. vtprotobuf should detect and support this API level for Edition files.

Hybrid mode allows both direct field access (like Open API) and accessor methods, giving flexibility to migrate from Open to Opaque gradually.

See: https://protobuf.dev/reference/go/opaque-faq/

title: JSON tag name rule not same as protoc-gen-go
description:
protoc-gen-go generates struct json tag name rule as aa_bb_cc, but vtprotobuf uses aaBbCc.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/158
Author: labulakalia

title: Marshal to multiple buffers
description:
For messages with many repeated fields, it would be nice to marshal to multiple slices using mem.BufferSlice rather than one giant one. This would avoid copying pre-serialized bytes in anypb.Any fields.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/151
Author: howardjohn

title: JSON marshaler
description:
Add a protojson compatible JSON marshaller that does not rely on reflection.

Example implementation: https://github.com/stackrox/stackrox/pull/14418

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/153
Author: janisz

title: Opaque API code generation support
description:
Edition 2024 uses the Opaque API by default (API_OPAQUE), where fields are private and accessed via getter/setter methods. Currently, vtprotobuf skips code generation for Opaque messages entirely, falling back to standard protobuf library.

Need to generate marshal/unmarshal code using accessor methods:
- GetFieldName() instead of direct m.FieldName access
- SetFieldName(value) for setting values
- HasFieldName() for presence checks
- ClearFieldName() for clearing

This is critical for Edition 2024 adoption as Opaque is the default.

See: https://protobuf.dev/reference/go/opaque-faq/

title: Use Pools in UnmarshalVT
description:
When a pooled message is a sub message of another message then the pool feature is not used in UnmarshalVT.

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/166
Author: janisz

title: Poolable messages paths with wildcard
description:
Add ability to use wildcards in pool flag to determine groups of messages instead of enumerating each message individually. Also consider adding a pool-exclude flag.

Example:
  pool=github.com/some/service/api/*

Instead of:
  pool=github.com/some/api/example1.Message1
  pool=github.com/some/api/example2.Message2
  ...

Original issue: https://github.com/planetscale/vtprotobuf/issues/114
Author: evgfedotov
